result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna M Reilly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 1 day granted.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Any remaining costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time STAYED.  N0 HUBER ALLOWED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anna M Reilly in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Williams Buttery moves to schedule these matters for a PLEAS hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anna M Reilly in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is seeking a global resolution in these matters.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anna M Reilly in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Buttery has just been assigned to this case and requests further proceedings date.  State provides copy of Criminal Complaint.  Defense waives further reading.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with co actors listed in the Criminal Complaint..Defendant allowed non collect call

Defendant Anna M Reilly in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.
